definition: to loathe/to hate/to abhor/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 e4]
to hate evil/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 wu4]

sentences.english: Men of this sort, “abusers of power”, both fascinated and repelled her.
sentences.chinese: 她对这类“滥权者”，既着迷又憎恶。

sentences.english: They that were sometime my counsellors, have abhorred me: and he whom I love most is turned against me.
sentences.chinese: 我的知交密友都憎恶我，我所爱的人也对我变了脸。

sentences.english: He didn't cut corners on quality but abhorred waste.
sentences.chinese: 他从不会省工省料，但憎恶浪费。

sentences.english: Hatred does not stir the stone men half so much as hunger.
sentences.chinese: 憎恶不及饥饿一半的可能扰动石人。

sentences.english: The catcher spat onto Robinson 's shoes, and the pitcher eyed him hatefully.
sentences.chinese: 捕手朝他的球鞋吐痰，投手则用憎恶的眼光瞪着他。

sentences.english: Her stepmother and stepsisters were very horrid to Cinderella.
sentences.chinese: 她的继母和继姐妹对灰姑娘非常憎恶。

sentences.english: Luld cs loathes expressionism and modernist art, but advocates realism.
sentences.chinese: 他憎恶表现主义和现代派艺术，提倡现实主义。

sentences.english: All that creepeth upon the earth shall be abominable, neither shall it be taken for meat.
sentences.chinese: 凡地上的爬虫，都是当憎恶的，都不可吃。

sentences.english: Roosevelt and Hull both replied in words that scarcely concealed their disgust.
sentences.chinese: 罗斯福和赫尔的答词，几乎没有隐藏他们的憎恶之情。

sentences.english: The insolence and brutality of anger, in the same manner, when we indulge its fury without check or restraint, is, of all objects, the most detestable.
sentences.chinese: 以此类推，无所顾忌傲慢粗鲁的愤怒是最令人憎恶的。

sentences.english: The dog evinced its dislike of strangers by growling .
sentences.chinese: 犬以咆哮表示憎恶生人。

sentences.english: Here, the people are sick too — more so than they were in Tunisia.
sentences.chinese: 这里，人都也感到憎恶，甚至比突尼斯人更强烈。

sentences.english: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted;
sentences.chinese: 因为他没有藐视憎恶受苦的人。

sentences.english: But perhaps these cultural boundaries exist to prevent Israelites from abominations?
sentences.chinese: 但也许这些文化壁垒的存在保护了以色列人免遭憎恶？

sentences.english: A network of hate, treachery, and fanaticism was closing around him.
sentences.chinese: 一个憎恶，背叛，狂热的网络编织在他周围。

sentences.english: Kings detest wrongdoing, for a throne is established through righteousness.
sentences.chinese: 作恶，为王所憎恶，因国位是靠公义坚立。

definition: to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
variant of 憤恨|愤恨[fen4 hen4]
